title: Big Audio Dynamite - Planet BAD (Greatest Hits)@320
description:
Culling together tracks chosen from a decade&#039;s (and seven albums&#039;) worth of material, Planet BAD serves as a focused, well-chosen compilation of Mick Jones&#039; post-Clash outfit. Although neither as critically or commercially successful as the Clash, Big Audio Dynamite&#039;s blend of rock and dance music, with a generous dose of samples, was a fixture on college radio in the mid- to late &#039;80s with tracks like "E=MC2," "The Bottom Line," and "C&#039;mon Every Beatbox" (all included here). The band even managed to make a foray onto the U.S. Top 40 charts in 1992 with the infectious "Rush." With his place already secure in rock annals, Jones&#039; work with BAD was much more lighthearted, but it cannily anticipated the influence electronics and technology would have on music. Despite the dated feel of some of Planet BAD, it&#039;s also undeniable that the band was a more interesting venture than it was sometimes given credit. (AMG)
